category.name: Aptitude
category.description: Develop mathematical reasoning and problem-solving skills for competitive exams and interviews.

sub_categories.name: Trigonometry
sub_categories.description: Master trigonometric functions, identities, and applications.

exercises.title: Basic Trigonometric Functions
exercises.description: Learn fundamental trigonometric functions and their properties.

tasks.title: Trigonometric Calculator
tasks.question:
Create a basic trigonometric function calculator.

Your calculator should:

  • Calculate sin, cos, tan for given angles
  • Handle angles in degrees and radians
  • Calculate inverse trigonometric functions
  • Handle special angles (0°, 30°, 45°, 60°, 90°)
  • Provide results with proper precision
tasks.hint: Use built-in math functions, convert degrees to radians, handle special cases

tasks.title: Trigonometric Values
tasks.question:
What is the value of cos(60°)?

Consider: Special angle values in trigonometry
tasks.hint: Remember the special triangle with angles 30°, 60°, 90°

tasks.title: Unit Circle Calculator
tasks.question:
Implement a unit circle calculator for trigonometric values.

Your calculator should:

  • Find coordinates on unit circle for given angle
  • Calculate sin and cos from unit circle
  • Handle angles in all quadrants
  • Provide reference angle calculations
  • Show quadrant information
tasks.hint: Use (cos θ, sin θ) coordinates, determine quadrant based on angle

exercises.title: Trigonometric Identities
exercises.description: Work with basic trigonometric identities and equations.

tasks.title: Identity Verifier
tasks.question:
Create a function to verify basic trigonometric identities.

Your function should:

  • Verify Pythagorean identity (sin²θ + cos²θ = 1)
  • Check quotient identity (tan θ = sin θ/cos θ)
  • Validate reciprocal identities
  • Test with different angle values
  • Return verification results
tasks.hint: Use numerical testing with various angles, check within tolerance
tasks.output: Verified: true, Left side: 1.0000, Right side: 1.0000

tasks.title: Pythagorean Identity
tasks.question:
What is the Pythagorean identity in trigonometry?

Consider: Relationship between sin and cos functions
tasks.hint: Think about the unit circle and the Pythagorean theorem
options: sin θ + cos θ = 1 - sum identity
sin θ × cos θ = 1 - product identity
sin θ - cos θ = 1 - difference identity

tasks.title: Trigonometric Equation Solver
tasks.question:
Implement a basic trigonometric equation solver.

Your solver should:

  • Solve simple equations like sin θ = k
  • Find solutions in specified interval
  • Handle multiple solutions
  • Use inverse trigonometric functions
  • Provide step-by-step solution
tasks.hint: Use inverse functions, consider periodicity, find all solutions in interval
